title: (x) DMV - California - Conga Brava {Mike Yanega}
content:
What's the font that says "Welcome to California" at the top here: [http://www.dmv.ca.gov](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051318/http:/www.dmv.ca.gov/)   
   
That "a" is **so** much like the one in my eventually-to-be-released Paphos.   
   
hhp
author: hrant

comments.content: I think the font is Adobe's "Conga Brava" in one of its medium weights.
To see a sample as 'evidence' click [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051318/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/F/CONQ/F_CONQ-10011000.jhtml).

That's it! Thanks.   
Michael Harvey. Figures.   
   
hhp

It "figures" that I like it - since I like Harvey's stuff. But I guess you don't think Conga Brava is typical of his style? Maybe you're right.   
   
hhp

\> Why do you like his work?   
   
Dunnno - good question.   
His stuff is very craftsmanlike.   
But maybe I'm also influenced by his endearing character. He strikes me as the sort of person who _could_ get away with being haughty and old-fashioned, but he's the exact opposite.   
   
hhp
